summary: NASA plans to conduct a lunar landing mission, known as the Artemis III mission, no earlier than in 2025. This is a delay of at least a year from earlier plans. While NASA has made progress on preparing for Artemis III (including planning its first test flight), we testified about challenges it faces in meeting its goal. For example, NASA is behind schedule on developing...
title: NASA Lunar Programs: Moon Landing Plans Are Advancing but Challenges Remain
